thread.title: Southampton defender Martin Caceres set to make debut in EFL Cup final despite not playing for a year
thread.title_full: Southampton defender Martin Caceres set to make debut in EFL Cup final despite not playing for a year

author: smorgan
title: Southampton defender Martin Caceres set to make debut in EFL Cup final despite not playing for a year
text:
EFL Gap year Southampton defender Martin Caceres set to make debut in EFL Cup final despite not playing for a year 
Former Barcelona and Juventus centre-back's move was delayed by brother's death but now he is ready to make mark By Sam Morgan Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SOUTHAMPTON new boy Martin Caceres is ready to make his debut in the EFL Cup final – despite not playing for a year. 
The former Barcelona and Juventus defender’s move to St Mary’s was delayed because of his brother’s death. The Digital South 2 Martin Caceres is finally ready to get playing again… this time for Southampton 
But now he is set to go straight into Claude Puel’s squad for next weekend’s Wembley showdown against Manchester United. 
And he insists he is up for the challenge Jose Mourinho’s side pose, even though he has not played since last February because of an Achilles injury. 
He said: “We have a cup final at the end of next week and I want to help my team-mates try to win a trophy and finish as high as we possibly can in the Premier League. 
“After six months without playing I cannot wait to put on a match shirt again and get out on the field. 
“That is what every player wants. I cannot thank Southampton enough for putting trust in me and I want to repay that on the pitch. Getty Images A post shared by Southampton FC (@southamptonfc) on Feb 16, 2017 at 2:34pm PST Manolo Gabbiadini scores on his debit for Southampton at St Mary's 
"Physically I am really good and feel like I am over the injury I had that made me stop for six months. I am confident I can get back to where I was. 
"The only thing I am lacking is to spend time with the team, which is what I want." 
Caceres, who has travelled with the Saints squad for a pre-Wembley training camp in Alicante, has also revealed Uruguay teammate Gaston Ramirez persuaded him to move to the south coast. 
The centre-back said: "Of all the options I had, this was the best one for me. I am very happy to come here. 
"It was a difficult decision to come from the Italian league from Juventus, but I wanted to play in England. A post shared by Southampton FC (@southamptonfc) on Feb 16, 2017 at 12:19pm PST Sunderland 0-4 Southampton : Manolo Gabbiadini brace does the job Related stories FOLLOWERS OF PASSION Lincoln's Cowley brothers are obsessed with football... and their eye for detail has turned Non-League Imps into feared giant-slayers ROO BETTER BELIEVE IT Manchester United could still flog skipper Wayne Rooney this month despite transfer window closing SCARED OF SCORING Claudio Ranieri says Leicester are full of fear in front of goal... but he won't be too scared to drop them FA People's Cup The FA is looking for passionate football bloggers and YouTubers to take part in the FA People's Cup Reffin' hell Premier League faces referee crisis with Michael Oliver targeted by MLS... just 48 hours after Mark Clattenburg quit NEW STRIKER Sleepy Lee...but will the defender's error cost his side? ROAR EMOTION Sutton striker Roarie Deacon has a photo of him signing for Arsenal pride of place in his home... now he is back in the frame for Arsene Wenger BALLS-UP FA hit Leyton Orient's Liam Kelly with six-match ban for pushing over Plymouth ballboy Beer we go All hands to the pump as Sutton United order 6,000 extra pint glasses for visit of Arsenal APPLE'S BEARING FRUIT Michael Appleton passes Oxford exam as he eyes Boro KO after beating Newcastle Jose's Cup of tea Jose Mourinho claims foreign bosses don't respect the FA Cup... but he will never field a weakened side 24/ 7 heaven Bruno claims to have discovered the fountain of youth — at Brighton's state-of-the-art HQ 
"Southampton opened the door to me playing English football and I am very grateful for that. I will give my all for the club. 
"For me the Premier League is the best in the world, and now I have the opportunity to play here I will enjoy it to the maximum. 
"I knew about Southampton because I had a friend from the Uruguayan national team, Gaston Ramirez. 
"When the option came I spoke to him and he spoke very highly of Southampton. He told me the club operates well and has fantastic fans. 
"That was one of the main reasons that drove me to move here."
